title: Airbag/SRS Light On (Constant)

likely_causes.notes: When SRS light is on, airbags may be disabled.

likely_causes.cause: Low battery voltage / recent jump start event
likely_causes.notes: Voltage dips can trigger SRS faults.
Common after moving seats or spills.

recommended_checks: Read SRS codes with a scan tool that supports SRS/ABS modules (not engine-only).
Check battery health and charging voltage; note any recent jump start or battery replacement.
Visually inspect for liquid spills under seats and obvious loose connectors WITHOUT unplugging SRS connectors.
If the light appeared after seat movement, note which seat and when it happened.
safety_warning: Do NOT attempt to bypass, short, probe, or unplug SRS connectors. Airbags may be disabled; seek qualified service.

title: Airbag/SRS Light Intermittent

likely_causes.cause: Loose ground / corrosion at connector or chassis ground
Seat occupancy sensor harness strain (seat tracks)
Voltage fluctuation from weak battery/alternator ripple

recommended_checks: Scan SRS for history codes and freeze-frame data if available.
Inspect battery terminals and primary grounds for corrosion/looseness (visual only).
Note correlation: does it happen when moving seat, hitting bumps, or during cold starts?
safety_warning: Intermittent SRS faults can disable airbags unexpectedly. Avoid DIY electrical probing on SRS circuits.

title: SRS After Collision / Airbag Deployed
symptom_short: Airbag deployed or vehicle had an accident; SRS light on

likely_causes.cause: Crash event stored; components require professional replacement and system verification
likely_causes.notes: Post-collision restraint system requires certified procedures.

recommended_checks: Document which airbags deployed and any seatbelt lockup/pretensioner signs.
Have SRS system inspected by certified repair facility with OEM procedures.
Do not drive if steering column/seatbelt components are compromised.
safety_warning: Post-deployment SRS work is high-risk and requires certified service; improper handling can cause injury.

title: Occupant Detection / Passenger Airbag OFF Issues
symptom_short: Passenger airbag OFF light behaves incorrectly or occupancy fault

likely_causes.cause: Occupant classification sensor/mat calibration or fault
Seat wiring/harness issue under passenger seat
Recent seat removal, seat cover changes, or heavy items on seat

recommended_checks: Check if the issue started after seat work, detailing, or seat cover changes.
Use SRS-capable scanner to identify occupant classification related codes.
Avoid placing heavy items on the passenger seat while diagnosing.
safety_warning: Passenger airbag may not deploy when needed. Do not attempt DIY calibration without OEM tools.

title: Possible Clock Spring / Steering Wheel SRS Circuit Issue
symptom_short: Airbag light + steering wheel button/horn issues
symptom_patterns: airbag light and horn not working
airbag light after steering wheel work

likely_causes.cause: Clock spring/steering angle harness circuit issue
Recent steering wheel removal or column work

recommended_checks: Note any recent steering/column repairs or aftermarket wheel installation.
Scan SRS for steering wheel circuit related codes.
Check whether horn and steering wheel controls fail together.
safety_warning: Do not remove airbag/steering wheel modules without certified procedures.

title: SRS Fault After Water/Spill Under Seat
symptom_short: SRS light after spill, flood, or wet carpet

likely_causes.cause: Water intrusion into module location (varies by vehicle)

recommended_checks: Dry the interior thoroughly and address leak source (sunroof drains, door seals, heater core signs).
Scan SRS codes to identify affected circuit/module.
Have a qualified shop inspect connectors and corrosion using OEM safety steps.
safety_warning: Moisture can damage restraint circuits. Avoid unplugging SRS connectors yourself.

title: SRS Light After Battery/Jump Start
symptom_short: SRS light after battery replacement or jump starting

likely_causes.cause: Battery terminals/grounds not tight or corroded

recommended_checks: Verify battery terminals are clean/tight and main grounds are secure (visual/physical check).
Scan SRS codes to confirm low-voltage history versus active circuit fault.
If codes return immediately, treat as active fault and seek service.
safety_warning: Clearing codes without resolving root cause may hide a real SRS failure.

title: Do Not Bypass SRS (Safety Rule)
symptom_short: User asks to bypass, trick, or disable SRS light/airbags

likely_causes.notes: This can cause injury and legal issues.

recommended_checks: Recommend certified diagnostics and OEM-compliant repair.
If user wants the light off, advise proper fault repair, not bypass.
safety_warning: Never bypass or disable airbags/SRS. It can cause severe injury or death and may be illegal.
